Article.ArticleTitle: Semi-synthesis and structural elucidation of brevicanines A-D, four new C<sub>19</sub>-diterpenoid alkaloids with rotameric phenomenon from Aconitum brevicalcaratum.

AbstractText: Four new C<sub>19</sub>-diterpenoid alkaloids brevicanines A-D (1-4) with rotameric phenomenon were isolated from Aconitum brevicalcaratum. They all possessed an unusual axial chiral phenyl-quinazoline side chain and their structures were elucidated by extensive spectroscopic analysis and chemical methods. Meanwhile, brevicanines A and B were semi-synthesized from their parent compound scaconine to further confirm their structures. Variable-temperature NMR spectroscopy was also used to investigate the atropisomers of brevicanine A, in which two sets of signals in <sup>1</sup>H NMR spectra were observed at room temperature and coalesced over 140 °C. It's the first time to determine the atropisomeric preference of diterpenoid alkaloids.
